description: This notification is used to inform the higher level management
function (SNMP Manager), that the alarm list has been rebuilt.

event.Summary: Alarm list has been rebuilt. Reason : $v2

description: IP Address of the EMS.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmEmsIpAddress

description: Reason why the higher level management function (SNMP Manager), has to
align its alarm list.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmRebuiltReason

description: This notification is used to inform the higher level management
function (SNMP Manager), that a new alarm has been raised at the EMS.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmNewAlarmNotification VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmEmsIpAddress a 192.0.2.1 VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmHandle u 9999 VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmSource s EXAMPLE VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmId i 9999 VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmRaisedTime s EXAMPLEE VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmEventType i 1 VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmPerceivedSeverity i 1 VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmProbableCause i 0 VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmAdditionalText s EXAMPLE

description: IP Address of the EMS.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmEmsIpAddress

description: Reference ID of the alarm in the Vanu EMS system. All alarm operations
by the higher layer management function(s) shall use this handle to
reference the alarm.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmHandle

description: Identifies the Distinguished Name of the entity generating the alarm.
The Distinguished Name of the alarm source in Vanu BSS are represented as follows:
BSC: BSC[host=<IP Address>]
AManager: BSC[host=<IP Address>]/AManager[pc=<SS7 Point Code of MSC in decimal>]
BTS: BSC[host=<IP Address>]/BTS[cellid=<Cell Identity>]
TRX: BSC[host=<IP Address>]/BTS[cellid=<Cell Identity>]/TRX[tei=<TEI>]
iPCU: BSC[host=<IP Address>]/PCU[cellid=<Cell Identity>]
GbAgg: BSC[host=<IP Address>]/GbAgg[nsei=<NSEI>]
LbManager: BSC[host=<IP Address>]/AManager[pc=<SS7 Point Code of SMLC in decimal>]
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmSource

description: Identification of an alarm in the EMS system.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmId

description: Date and time when the alarm is raised by the alarmed resource.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmRaisedTime

description: Type of alarm event.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmEventType

description: Perceived severity of an alarm indicating the relative level of urgency
for operator attention.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmPerceivedSeverity

description: Provides further information of the alarm.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmProbableCause

description: Provides further information on the alarm than 'Probably Cause'.
If further information is NOT desired for an alarm, a zero-length string
may be returned.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmAdditionalText

description: This notification is used to inform the higher level management
function (SNMP Manager), that an acknowledgement state of an existing
alarm has been modified at the EMS.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAckStateChangedNotification VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmEmsIpAddress a 192.0.2.1 VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmHandle u 9999 VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmSource s EXAMPLE VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmId i 9999 VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmAckTime s EXAMPLEE VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmAckUserId s EXAMPLE VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmAckState i 0

description: IP Address of the EMS.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmEmsIpAddress

description: Reference ID of the alarm in the Vanu EMS system. All alarm operations
by the higher layer management function(s) shall use this handle to
reference the alarm.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmHandle

description: Identifies the Distinguished Name of the entity generating the alarm.
The Distinguished Name of the alarm source in Vanu BSS are represented as follows:
BSC: BSC[host=<IP Address>]
AManager: BSC[host=<IP Address>]/AManager[pc=<SS7 Point Code of MSC in decimal>]
BTS: BSC[host=<IP Address>]/BTS[cellid=<Cell Identity>]
TRX: BSC[host=<IP Address>]/BTS[cellid=<Cell Identity>]/TRX[tei=<TEI>]
iPCU: BSC[host=<IP Address>]/PCU[cellid=<Cell Identity>]
GbAgg: BSC[host=<IP Address>]/GbAgg[nsei=<NSEI>]
LbManager: BSC[host=<IP Address>]/AManager[pc=<SS7 Point Code of SMLC in decimal>]
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmSource

description: Identification of an alarm in the EMS system.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmId

description: Time when acknowledgement state of the alarm changes.
Until the alarm is NOT ack'ed, a value of '0000000000000000'H shall be
returned.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmAckTime

description: Last user who has changed the acknowledgement state of the alarm.
If an alarm is NOT Ack'ed, a zero-length string may be returned.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmAckUserId

description: Acknowledgement state of the alarm.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmAckState

description: This notification is used to inform the higher level management
function (SNMP Manager), that an existing alarm has been cleared.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmClearedAlarmNotification VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmEmsIpAddress a 192.0.2.1 VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmHandle u 9999 VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmSource s EXAMPLE VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmId i 9999 VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmClearedTime s EXAMPLEE VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmClearUserId s EXAMPLE

description: IP Address of the EMS.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmEmsIpAddress

description: Reference ID of the alarm in the Vanu EMS system. All alarm operations
by the higher layer management function(s) shall use this handle to
reference the alarm.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmHandle

description: Identifies the Distinguished Name of the entity generating the alarm.
The Distinguished Name of the alarm source in Vanu BSS are represented as follows:
BSC: BSC[host=<IP Address>]
AManager: BSC[host=<IP Address>]/AManager[pc=<SS7 Point Code of MSC in decimal>]
BTS: BSC[host=<IP Address>]/BTS[cellid=<Cell Identity>]
TRX: BSC[host=<IP Address>]/BTS[cellid=<Cell Identity>]/TRX[tei=<TEI>]
iPCU: BSC[host=<IP Address>]/PCU[cellid=<Cell Identity>]
GbAgg: BSC[host=<IP Address>]/GbAgg[nsei=<NSEI>]
LbManager: BSC[host=<IP Address>]/AManager[pc=<SS7 Point Code of SMLC in decimal>]
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmSource

description: Identification of an alarm in the EMS system.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmId

description: Date and time when the alarm was cleared.
Until the alarm moves to clear state, a value of '0000000000000000'H
shall be returned.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmClearedTime

description: Identity of the user who invokes the clearAlarms operation.
Until an alarm is cleared by a user, a zero-length string shall be
returned.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmClearUserId

description: This notification is used to inform the higher level management
function (SNMP Manager), that the comments of an existing alarm has
has been modified at the EMS.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmCommentsNotification VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmEmsIpAddress a 192.0.2.1 VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmHandle u 9999 VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmSource s EXAMPLE VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmId i 9999 VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmCommentTime s EXAMPLEE VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmCommentUserId s EXAMPLE VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmCommentText s EXAMPLE

description: IP Address of the EMS.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmEmsIpAddress

description: Reference ID of the alarm in the Vanu EMS system. All alarm operations
by the higher layer management function(s) shall use this handle to
reference the alarm.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmHandle

description: Identifies the Distinguished Name of the entity generating the alarm.
The Distinguished Name of the alarm source in Vanu BSS are represented as follows:
BSC: BSC[host=<IP Address>]
AManager: BSC[host=<IP Address>]/AManager[pc=<SS7 Point Code of MSC in decimal>]
BTS: BSC[host=<IP Address>]/BTS[cellid=<Cell Identity>]
TRX: BSC[host=<IP Address>]/BTS[cellid=<Cell Identity>]/TRX[tei=<TEI>]
iPCU: BSC[host=<IP Address>]/PCU[cellid=<Cell Identity>]
GbAgg: BSC[host=<IP Address>]/GbAgg[nsei=<NSEI>]
LbManager: BSC[host=<IP Address>]/AManager[pc=<SS7 Point Code of SMLC in decimal>]
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmSource

description: Identification of an alarm in the EMS system.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmId

description: Time when the comment has been added to the alarm.
Until a comment is added to an alarm by a user, a value of
'0000000000000000'H shall be returned.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmCommentTime

description: Identification of the user who made the last comment (change).
Until a comment has been added/modified to an alarm by a user, a
zero-length string shall be returned.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmCommentUserId

description: Carries the textual comment.
Until a comment has been added to an alarm by a user, a zero-length
string shall be returned.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmAlarmCommentText

description: This notification is used to inform the higher level management
function (SNMP Manager), that the integrity alarm list at the
SNMP Manager is compromised.
It is expected that the higher level management function synchronizes
its alarm list once again.

event.Summary: Alarm list integrity compromised by potential fault : $v2

description: IP Address of the EMS.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmEmsIpAddress

description: Reason why the confidence is lost in the integrity of its alarm list
maintained by higher level management function (SNMP Manager) MAY need
to rebuild the alarm list at its end.
variables.name: VANU-ITFN-FM-MIB::vanuItfNFmPotentialFaultReason
